review.description: I have ordered pizza here a few times while staying at the Marriott Brooklyn Bridge, and the pizza is solid. Good Cheese, decent meats. with a sweet sauce, that is a little on the crushed tomato side. They could cook it a little more as the bottom will fall on the fold towards the front of the slice. Dough is good, a little lighter than I would prefer but overall I will order from them anytime I am here given the consistency and good solid taste.
review.author: Al C.

review.description: Great place. Pizza was delicious but not overwhelming. Owner is a straight original Italian. Great conversation. Coming back
review.author: Seyed G.

review.description:
I felt like I struck gold when I came in here. 

My husband and I have been griping about what Brooklyn Pizza places have become for quite some time now (I know I'm obnoxious because I'm only 22 - but you know what?  Pizza was 10x better when I was 5) . Any who when we dined here we were impressed and cheered up. 

First off, they're off of Court street which is a major street with foot traffic and LOTS of hungry people. I had passed by this place and doubted it survive because its on Livingston and kind of hidden from Court Street.  However, after dining here and tasting their pizza and seeing their prices, I believe they will do very well. 

Coming in, the place has a great feel to it.  It's bright, clean, spacious and modern.   It doesn't have the typical look of most pizzeria's but it's also not so far from it that you're not sure what kind of food they make.  

They have a friendly staff who are just so chill and relaxed that it feels like a neighborhood place and not nestled in loud bustling downtown Brooklyn. 

The pizza is GOOOOOD!   I like the slightly rubbery cheese and the sauce; the crust wasn't burnt which was nice since that seems to be too much to ask for now a days.  They have unique mozzarella sticks in that they are made in a particular batter I can't put my finger on. The batter reminds me very much of the batter used on most things in Park Slope's chip shop. It might not be for every body but I feel like I'm eating healthier Mozzarella sticks, and believing that makes me feel better inside. 

Their specials and deals are really good.  They have a text program where you can receive coupons. A big flat screen they keep at a moderate volume and a cute seasoning station. Their tables have nice back splash and the whole restaurant gets ton of natural light from outside. Also free wifi. :) 

From their logo to their pizza this place is great.  I hope more people discover and enjoy it.
review.author: Kassandra O.

review.description: I order from here regularly and it is always excellent. Be warned, the large pizzas are huge! Orders are prompt and the pizza has always been hot on arrival, my go to place in the heights.
review.author: Gavin P.

review.description:
This is a great no frills spot to get a slice in downtown Brooklyn.  The space itself is very new and modern looking however its not a very large space and there is not much seating.  There maybe 6 small tables and a counter running along the wall.

The pizza is amazing though.  The pesto tomato slice is is a must try.  I've also had the pepperoni and plain and they are both great.  Though this place might not win any city wide competitions, it's a perfect spot for a quick slice, where you know they won't over cook it and use fresh sauce and cheese.
review.author: Drex H.

review.description:
This free can of soda coupon is BULLSHIT. Also, the owner was super rude on the phone. When I called to make sure that the delivery guy would bring my soda, he was suddenly too busy to stay on the phone and said he would call me back - which he never did.

My first and last time ordering from this place. There was nothing wrong with the pizza itself, but I hate to give my money to people who treat their customers the way they do.
review.author: Laura O.

review.description: The place doesn't look like much from the outside - looks like just another pizza place. But one bite and you can tell - thin crust and slightly crispy on the bottom. Juicy mozzarella cheese on top, and tomato sauce bursting with flavour. And huge slices are only $2.50 for such a high quality pizza!
review.author: Dahokolomoki Z.

review.description:
I probably would have loved this place when I was a kid. Lots of cheese, the flavors aren't too challenging, and lots of cheese. 

I'm not a kid, though. The crust is way too bready, there's not much flavor, and there's far too much cheese. Sorry, guys. Nothing personal.
review.author: Frank E.

review.description: The worst. Placed an order at 7:39 was still not delivered by 9. Called them, they acted like I was inconveniencing them with my inquiry, complaining they were so busy and it was in the way. 20 minutes later called back they said it's on the way- do what you want, first attempt at using them, utter disgrace. Guess they don't need nor want new customers
review.author: Stacey L.

review.description: So so good! Great traditional pizza and the crust is amazing. Really some of the best NYC style I've ever had. Nice, bright, clean place and simple menu.
review.author: S. H.

review.description: Super fast delivery, and AMAZING pizza. Really good. Sweet sauce, really juicy. Margarita was delicious. Definitely ordering again.
review.author: Meg S.

review.description:
It was love at first bite.

Everything we have tried has been amazing. The crust, the sauce, the bread used for the sandwiches, and the chicken cutlet (according to my boyfriend, who considers himself an aficionado of sorts) are all superb.       He also digs the side order of meatballs as a hearty starter. Our favorite pizza to share is the margarita- thick, large slices of mozzarella nestled in incredible sauce and drizzles of high quality olive oil.  The bf also loves the buffalo chicken. They don't skimp, either- lots of food for an extremely reasonable price.

The staff is lovely and warm. And speaking of warm, go for one of their chocolate chip cookies. My brother moved to LA last month, and begs me to send him cookies from Piz-zetta! When I dined in with him, Anthony waited to warm up our cookie until we gave him a thumbs up to indicate we were through with our meal. Very thoughtful!

This place might be off the beaten path of Court Street, but only by a few hundred feet. SO worth it. 

Side note- If you use Delivery.com, their whole menu isn't on there.
review.author: L O.

review.description: Good pies for reasonable prices and the delivery is pretty fast. I've had single slices, too, and they are definitely passable, although I found the crust to be a bit too crispy for my taste. I have certainly had better pizza in New York but this place is good enough to go back.
review.author: Nicholas A R.

review.description: Solid pizza, but not amazing. Have a decent variety of rolls too. I had a cheese slice, a chicken and broccoli slice and garlic knots and it was fine. Not really impressed for Brooklyn though. I wouldn't order garlic knots again.
review.author: Cameron G.

review.description: How is it that even a majority of the 3 or 3 1/2 star pizza places on Long Island are better than most of the 4 or 4 1/2 star pizza places in the city. Why do the people that come here have such low standards? I mean it's good, but I have no reason to ever come back here.
review.author: James J.

review.description: Piz-zetta has been my go-to spot since moving to Brooklyn. Amazing and affordable dishes, friendly staff, great management team; I look forward to growing fat with you guys! :)
review.author: Jacob G.

review.description: Seriously the best cheese pizza I've ever had. I love this place. My boyfriend also loves their buffalo chicken pizza. They do by the slice if you don't want a whole pie. They are very quick and friendly but most importantly, the pizza is amazing.
review.author: Katie K.

review.description: Best Margherita Pizza and garlic knots EVER!!! Service is quick, the place is clean and people are so friendly :)
review.author: Kelly F.

review.description: This pizza was great! Authentic NY pizza and really affordable. We had 2 slices and 2 bottles of water and it came to $7.50. The guys were really friendly and welcoming. We would definitely go back!
review.author: Leah H.

review.description:
There are three reasons why I give this 5 stars...which I rarely give 5 stars.  
1) They offer the option of online ordering (delivery and take-out) through Yelp. It was very quick and simple.  I LOVE that it also provides you with an estimated delivery time.
2) Delivery was very fast and the delivery person was very friendly and personable.
3) The pizza was great though it wasn't the best I have ever had in NY. We ordered 3 pizzas (cheese/pepperoni/blanco). The white pizza was my favorite.
review.author: Lia A.
